Package com.group19.payrollGUI

Class Date

java.lang.Object
com.group19.payrollGUI.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Date>
The Date class contains fields/methods for an object of type Date. Three fields make up the month, day, and year of a Date. Methods included to check if a Date is valid (i.e., is not earlier than 1900, and is not in the future). Testbed main used to ensure isValid() is exhaustive as possible.
Author:
Sagnik Mukherjee, Michael Choe

    • Date

      public Date()

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Determines if Date contents follow the Gregorian Calendar. The year may not be less than 1900, and the day must be less than or equal to 28, 29, 30, or 31, depending on the month and whether or not the Date contains a leap year, to be valid. If the date could not be found on a printed calendar for the given year, or is in the future, it is not a valid date.
      Returns:
      true if date is valid, false otherwise

    • isInFuture

      private boolean isInFuture​(int month, int day, int year)
      Helper method for isValid(), checks if date is in the future. If the date passed has not occurred yet (i.e., is greater than the current date on the Gregorian Calendar), this method returns true.
      Parameters:
      month - int value for this.month
      day - int value for this.day
      year - int value for this.year
      Returns:
      true if date is in the future, false otherwise

    • isLeap

      private boolean isLeap()
      Helper method for isValid(), checks if this.year is leap year. If the year is only divisible by 4, it is a leap year. If it is divisible by 4, 100, and 400, it is a leap year. By assuming it is not a leap year to begin with, we can skip two else-cases.
      Returns:
      true if leap year, false otherwise

    • isDayValid

      private boolean isDayValid​(boolean isLeapYear)
      Helper method for isValid(), checks if this.day is valid. Most months on the Gregorian calendar have either 30 or 31 days. February is the exception, having 28 days, or 29 in a leap year. Thus, we use a switch-case structure to validate if this.day fits within the constraints, which depend on the month.
      Parameters:
      isLeapYear - boolean from isLeap() method call in isValid()
      Returns:
      true if day valid, false otherwise

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Date that)
      Compare passed Date (that) with invoking Date object (this).
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      that - Date to be compared to by invoking object
      Returns:
      -1 if this is less, 1 if this is greater, 0 if equal

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()

      Returns:
      String literal of Book field values
